title: Fredericksburg & Spotsylvania National Military Park: Battlefield Campfire Programs
body: Battlefield Campfire Programs          NPS Photo       Subscribe  | What is RSS    News Release Date: June 22, 2016  In this Centennial year for the National Park Service, Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania NMP will revive the tradition of park rangers telling stories around a crackling campfire. On three summer Saturday evenings, the park will present family-friendly campfire programs at the Sunken Road, next to the Fredericksburg Battlefield Visitor Center. Programs will explore the realities of darkness on the battlefields, the role of animals in the war—mascots, mounts, and pets—and the history of the National Park Service itself. July 2 – Night on the Battlefield July 30 – Companions in Battle: Animals of War August 20 – Solemnity, Grandeur, and Everyday People:100 Years of National Parks. All programs begin at 8:00, will last about one hour.Park at the Fredericksburg Battlefield Visitor Center at 1013 Lafayette Boulevard, Fredericksburg, 22401. Visitors are encouraged to bring lawn chairs and flashlights. All programs are family (and pet) friendly, free of charge, and open to the public. For additional information, call (540) 693-3200.
